pageTitle: GOV.UK One Login questions and answers - Access to work
h1: GOV.UK One Login questions and answers
p1: GOV.UK One Login lets you sign in to government services using the same email address and password. It is not the same as Government Gateway.
p2: In future you’ll need to use it to access all services on GOV.UK.
h3: What do I need to create a GOV.UK One Login?

p3.pointTwo: a way to get security codes – either a mobile phone number or an authenticator app
p3.paragraph2: To prove your identity, you’ll need:
p3.pointThree: a valid photo ID, such as a passport or driving licence
p3.paragraph3: Or, if you haven’t got photo ID, you can still prove your identity with:
p3.pointFour: your bank or building society account details

p4: Creating a GOV.UK One Login takes a few minutes.
h5: Do I need to do anything before 26 November 2025?
p5: You cannot sign in to Access to Work with GOV.UK One Login before 26 November, but you can create a GOV.UK One Login account if you do not already have one.
p6: The first time you sign in with GOV.UK One Login, you’ll also be asked to add your first name and last name to complete your user profile.
h6: I already have a GOV.UK  One Login account. Can I use it for Access to Work?
p7: Yes. If you already use GOV.UK  One Login for another government service, you can use it to sign into Access to Work from 26 November 2025.
h7: Should I use the same email address as my current Access to Work account?
p8: Using the same email address for GOV.UK  One Login will make it simpler, but it’s not essential.
h8: I’m having problems signing up to GOV.UK One Login. What should I do?
p9: Ensure your email, password and security code have been entered correctly.
p10: If the problems continue, contact GOV.UK One Login.
h9: What do I do if I have problems proving my identity?
